intro: Psiadia gnaphaliopais, commonly known as the narrow-leaved goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in composite inflorescences, and it has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Psiadia gnaphaliopais is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
